intro: Peucedanum triternatum var. leptophyllum, commonly known as the slenderleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small white to pale yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and habitats.
